Deficiency Narrative: Six children in care were observed with only one staff member present.
Correction Narrative:
On September 16, 2025 an email was received from the Administrator stating; Rays of Life management
team acknowledges the importance of maintaining
required child/caregiver ratios to ensure the safety, supervision, and developmental needs of
children in care. To address this concern, we have
implemented a revised staffing plan and identified
trained PRN caregivers to provide coverage in the event of staff shortages, illness, or emergencies. In addition, daily attendance, staffing schedules, and staffing records will be monitored by the
Executive Director and or Administrator to confirm
ongoing compliance with ratio requirements, and all
caregivers will receive refresher training on CCR
standards. These steps will help ensure that ratios are consistently maintained and that the safety and well-being of all children remain our top priority.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was determined that the last validation date of the employee background checks was completed on 02/24/2025.
Correction Narrative: Rays of Life GRO Administrator/Executive Director/Manager will address the deficiency regarding failure to validate background checks every three months. The operation has completed a full review and validation of the current list of all staff, volunteers, and individuals requiring background checks as of 06/13/2025.  Moving forward, a recurring calendar reminder and a compliance tracking system have been established to ensure that background check validations are conducted and documented every three months, as required. The Administrator/Executive Director/Manager or designated compliance coordinator will be responsible for completing and maintaining accurate records of each quarterly validation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was determined that the gas inspection certificate of the operation was expired.
Correction Narrative:
Rays of Life GRO Administrator/Executive Director/Manager will address the deficiency regarding the timely inspection of the facilitys gas system. The operation has scheduled a licensed gas inspection to be completed by 06/13/2025, in order to meet the required 24-month inspection interval. A copy of the inspection report will be maintained on-site and submitted to the appropriate licensing authority once the inspection is completed. To prevent recurrence, a tracking system including calendar reminders and a compliance log has been established to ensure that future gas inspections are scheduled and completed within the required timeframe. The Director or Facilities Manager will review all facility safety inspection deadlines on a quarterly basis to maintain ongoing compliance with regulatory maintenance schedules.

Gas leak test was completed on 6/12/25.

Deficiency Narrative: When RCCR Inspector arrived at the operation for inspection, a caregiver was outside seated in a car while multiple children in care were awake and walking about in the living room of the home. The caregiver was the only one on duty at the time.
Correction Narrative: Inspector talked to 3 of the 7 kids who confirmed there is typically 2 to 3 staff present during the day and a least 1 staff at night. During the walk-through ratio was confirmed compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's evening medication log was observed to be documented early in the day on 03/19/25 showing that the medication was administered, although it was not.
Correction Narrative: Rays of Life GRO Administrator/Manager/Supervisor/ will ensure that the medication record will be reviewed and all staff will receive immediate training on documentation requirements as outlined in the minimum standards. The training will specifically address the importance of timely and accurate recordkeeping, emphasizing that the cumulative medication record must be updated within two hours of administration. To support compliance, a new documentation protocol will be implemented, including real-time entry expectations and supervisor verification during shift changes. Oversight will be provided by the program director or designee, who will review medication logs daily to ensure timely entries are made. Staff who fail to meet documentation requirements will receive corrective feedback and, if necessary, additional retraining.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that a child did not receive the morning dosage of his prescribed medication on 03/19/2025.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, an audit of the medications of four out of seven children in care showed that medications are now being administered and documented timely.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon review of a DFPS investigation, it was determined that staff member put a child in care in the closet as a means to control or immediate the child.
Correction Narrative:
Director sent email stating the following: Rays of Life GRO Executive Director/ Administrator will Conduct mandatory trainings for all staff on childrens rights, emphasizing the prohibition of demeaning, harmful, or isolating behaviors. For accountability Rays of Life will reinforce an incident reporting system and establish a safe system for children to provide feedback or report concerns about their treatment where any suspected violations of childrens rights can be reported confidentially and addressed promptly. Increase supervision and monitoring of staff interactions with children to ensure compliance with childrens rights policies and the Minimum Standards. Provide additional coaching and corrective feedback to staff demonstrating inappropriate behavior.
Please

Deficiency Narrative: Upon arrival at the operation, RCCR Inspectors knocked on the door. Staff was not around and one of the children at the operation answered the door allowing Inspectors inside the operation.
Correction Narrative: Upon arrival the staff answered the door, and the children were active in the Livingroom area. The staff was active and no children came to the door.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, 1 out of the 3 files reviewed did not contain verification for all requirred trainings.Staff did not complet EBI training.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator that included a corrective action plan indicating she will be responsible for ensuring all new hire requirements are obtained upon hire moving forward. The email also contained a copy of all employee's current EBI training certificates.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, all beds were observed missing flats sheets.
During the inspection, 1 out 3 employee files did not contain verification of TB.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator that included a corrective action plan indicating she will be responsible for ensuring all new hire requirements are obtained upon hire moving forward. The email also contained a copy of the employee's TB test.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of three employee files reviewed did not contain a TB test or drug test. One out of three employee files reviewed did not contain verification of educational requirements.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator/executive director will complete an audit of all personnel files to ensure their accuracy and completion. It also indicated the administrator/executive director will ensure all employees have obtained a TB and drug test before employment.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two youth medication files reviewed were missing either a signature, date, and/or time to indicate the medication was given.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator/executive director will be responsible for conducting daily audits of the medication log. It also indicated a secondary auditor will also check for completion of the med logs daily.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three youth files reviewed did not contain a PLSP signature on the admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator/executive director will be responsible for completing an audit of all current files to ensure all signatures are on the required documents. It also indicated the administrator/executive director will ensure the PLSP signs all required documents moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three youth files reviewed did not contain an initial or preliminary service plan. One out of three youth files reviewed did not contain an admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator/executive director will be responsible for utilizing a checklist at admission to ensure all required documents are obtained/completed. It also indicated routine audits will be conducted of the files to ensure their completion and accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication record was reviewed and did not contain a signature of who administered the medication.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator/executive director will be responsible for conducting daily audits of the medication log. It also indicated a secondary auditor will also check for completion of the med logs daily.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's file reviewed was missing the Admission Assessment, Child Orientation, and Service Plan.
Correction Narrative: Corrected

Deficiency Narrative: One child's file reviewed did not have the required criteria on the exterior or in a clearly visible location.
Correction Narrative: Corrected

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication record was reviewed and did not contain the time a dosage was given or a signature of who administered the medication.

Correction Narrative: Corrected

Deficiency Narrative: One employee of the operation is under age 21 and has been the only staff working on shift with the group of youth who are more than 13 years old.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator, Adrienne Lee, which included a corrective action plan that indicated a manager/supervisor will be present to monitor any employee under the age of 21 who is only allowed to work with the youth under the age of 12.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of three employee files reviewed contained a drug test taken more than 1 year prior to employment with the operation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator, Adrienne Lee, which included a corrective action plan indicating she will be responsible for ensuring all newly hired staff complete a drug test before being allowed access to youth in care.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three youth files reviewed did not contain a preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator, Adrieene Lee, which included a corrective action plan that indicated she will be responsible for ensuring the Treatment Director completes a preliminary service plan that addresses all the youth's needs within the timeframe moving forward. She stated during the inspection that the operation lost their Treatment Director and many of the responsibilities for that position has not been completed. She indicated they are searching to hire a new one though.

Deficiency Narrative: Several documents reviewed contained errors such as wrong dates or names listed on the documents.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator, Adrieene Lee, which included a corrective action plan that indicated either the executive director or administrator will ensure all documents are kept true, current, accurate, and complete.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three admission assessments reviewed were not signed by the PLSP.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator, Adrieene Lee, which included a corrective action plan that indicated she will be responsible for following up with the PLSP/Treatment Director to ensure all service plans have been signed timely.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of one child files reviewed did not contain in a visibly accessible place the known allergies or medical conditions for the child.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator that included a file face sheet for the child in care that shows known allergies. This is intended to be placed on the exterior of the child's file.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two employee files reviewed did not included a concrete date of employment. One out of the two employee files reviewed did not have the affidavit for employment notarized.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator, Adrienne Lee, that included New Hire Checklists to show the date of employment. It also included the completed affidavit for the employee as well.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation needs to hire a Treatment Director based on the services they will provide. Verification of this will need to be by the intended Treatment Director having an active background check under the operation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner, Armando Richardson, indicating a treatment director will be hired by the comply by date as there is one the operation has in mind of hiring. The operation is actively working to hire one.
